intro: Cogswellia artemisiarum, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and ability to store water in its leaves. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration. Cogswellia artemisiarum plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various desert animals.
